question.body: Now that you’ve read a little more about muscle tissue, what do you think the doctor will tell Seymour?

multiple_choice.choice: Seymour will probably be told to rest and it will correct itself with time.
Seymour may be a candidate for surgery to push the tissue back and insert a mesh to reinforce the abdominal muscle.
Seymour will probably have to have the section of his small intestine surgically removed and the abdominal muscle reinforced.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Seymour is in pain and has a noticeable bulge, which signifies that additional treatment is necessary.
Correct. Since Seymour is young and has an active lifestyle, surgical repair of the hernia is probably the best option.
Incorrect. Seymour’s small intestine did not die, he sought treatment before this happened. Removal of the small intestine would only be done in drastic situations.

part.hint: Think about the abdominal muscles and how they might be strengthened to continue to support the digestive organs and tissues.
